member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setActive(bool)
member.summary: Opens or closes the console. By default the console is closed.
member.param: True to make the console active (opened); otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.isActive const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the console is opened or closed.
member.returns: True if the console is active (opened); otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setBackgroundColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets a background color for the console.
member.param: Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.isCommand(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if a command with a given name exists.
member.returns: true if the command with a given name exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getCommandDescription(char) const
member.summary: Returns the description of the console command by its name. If the name isn't specified, an empty string will be returned.
member.returns: The command description if it exists; otherwise, an empty string.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getCommandName(int) const
member.summary: Returns the name of the console command by its number in the array of the existing commands.
member.returns: The command name if it is found in the array of the existing commands; otherwise, an empty string.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setErrorColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets a color for error messages in the console.
member.param: Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setFloat(char,float)
member.summary: Sets a float value for a given variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getFloat(char) const
member.summary: Returns a float value of a given variable.
member.returns: Float value of the variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getFloatMax(char) const
member.summary: Returns a maximum float value for a given variable.
member.returns: Maximum float value of the variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getFloatMin(char) const
member.summary: Returns a minimum float value for a given variable.
member.returns: Minimum float value of the variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.isFloat(char) const
member.summary: Checks if the value set for the given console variable is of the float type.
member.returns: True if the variable value is float; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setInt(char,int)
member.summary: Sets an integer value for a given variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getInt(char) const
member.summary: Returns an integer value of a given variable.
member.returns: Integer value of the variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getIntMax(char) const
member.summary: Returns a maximum integer value for a given variable.
member.returns: Maximum integer value of the variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getIntMin(char) const
member.summary: Returns a minimum integer value for a given variable.
member.returns: Minimum integer value of the variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.isInt(char) const
member.summary: Checks if the value of the given console variable is of the integer type.
member.returns: True if the variable value is int; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setLock(int)
member.summary: Disables or enables the console. By default the console is enabled.
member.param: Positive integer to disable the console; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getLock const
member.summary: Checks if the console is disabled.
member.returns: 1 if the console is disabled; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setMessageColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets a color for ordinary messages in the console.
member.param: Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getNumCommands const
member.summary: Returns the number of all available console commands, including the custom ones.
member.returns: The number of available console commands.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getNumVariables const
member.summary: Returns the number of all available console variables.
member.returns: The number of available console variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.addOutputCallback(Unigine.CallbackBase2{char,int})
member.summary: Adds a callback function that will be executed when a text is output to the console. The function is useful when you implement a custom console, for example. The callback function must receive 2 arguments: const char *text - a text that is output to the console, int level - one of the LEVEL_* variables that indicate the type of the output text. The value can be important for setting a color for console messages, for example.
member.param: The callback pointer. The callback arguments must be: (const char *text, int level).
member.returns: ID of the last added callback of the specified type, if the callback was added successfully; otherwise, nullptr. This ID can be used to remove this callback when necessary.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.removeOutputCallback(void)
member.summary: Removes the specified callback from the list of output callbacks.
member.param: Callback ID obtained when adding it.
member.returns: True if the callback with the given ID was removed successfully; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.clearOutputCallbacks
member.summary: Clears all added output callbacks.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setPrompt(char)
member.summary: Updates the console prompt. The default prompt is Unigine~#.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getPrompt const
member.summary: Returns the console prompt.
member.returns: The prompt text.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.isPalette(char) const
member.summary: Checks for a palette with the specified name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setPalette(char,Palette)
member.summary: Sets a color palette by its name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setPalette(char,int,float)
member.summary: Sets a value for the specified palette color by its index.
member.param: Value to be set for the color with the specified index.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setPalette(char,char,float)
member.summary: Sets a value for the specified palette color by the color name.
member.param: Value to be set for the color with the specified name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getPalette(char) const
member.summary: Returns a color palette by its name.
member.returns: Palette with the specified name is it exists; otherwise nullptr.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setString(char,char)
member.summary: Sets a string value for a given variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getString(char) const
member.summary: Returns the string value of a given variable.
member.returns: String value of the variable.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.isString(char) const
member.summary: Checks if the value of the given console variable is of the string type.
member.returns: True if the variable value is string; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setTextColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)

member.param: Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.isVariable(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if a variable with a given name exists.
member.returns: True if the variable exists; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns the description of the console variable by its name. If the name isn't specified, an empty string will be returned.

member.summary: Returns the name of the console variable by its number in the array of the existing variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setWarningColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets a color for warning messages in the console.
member.param: Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.addCommand(char,char,Unigine.CallbackBase)
member.summary: Adds a custom console command bound to a given callback function.
member.param: Name of the new console command.
Short description to be displayed in the console.
The callback pointer. The callback arguments must be (int argc, char** argv,...).
member.returns: 1 if the custom command is added successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.flush
member.summary: Forces to execute all queued console commands.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.removeCommand(char)
member.summary: Removes a custom console command.
member.param: Name of the custom console command.
member.returns: true if the custom command has been removed successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.run(char)
member.summary: Runs the specified console command.

member.summary: Returns the background color for the console.
member.returns: Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getMessageColor const
member.summary: Returns the color for ordinary messages in the console.
member.returns: Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getWarningColor const
member.summary: Returns the color for warning messages in the console.
member.returns: Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.

member.summary: Returns the color for error messages in the console.
member.returns: Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.

member.summary: Returns the current font size used for console messages.
member.param: New font size to be set for console messages

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getFontSize const
member.summary: Returns the current font size used for console messages.
member.returns: Current font size set for console messages

member.summary: Sets the height of the console.
member.param: Height of the console as percentage of the window height.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getHeight const
member.summary: Returns the console height in percentage of the window height.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setLimit(int)
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of messages the console can output.
member.param: Maximum number of messages the console can output.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getLimit const
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of messages the console can output. The default value is 16384.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setWrapping(bool)
member.summary: Enables the text wrapping to the next line.
member.param: true to set the text wrapping; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.isWrapping const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the text wrapping is enabled for the console.

member.summary: Shows or hides the onscreen overlay.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.isOnscreen const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the onscreen overlay is shown or hidden.
member.returns: True if the overlay is shown; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Sets the size for the onscreen overlay font.
member.param: Size for the onscreen overlay font.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getOnscreenFontSize const
member.summary: Returns the size of the onscreen overlay font.
member.returns: The size of the console font.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.setOnscreenHeight(int)
member.summary: Sets the height value for the onscreen overlay.
member.param: Height of the onscreen overlay in percentage of the window height.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getOnscreenHeight const
member.summary: Returns the height for the onscreen overlay.
member.returns: The height of the onscreen overlay in percentage of the window height.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getOnscreenTime const
member.summary: Returns the time during which the text is displayed on the screen.
member.returns: The time in seconds.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.write(char)
member.summary: Writes the specified text to the console and displays it on the screen (onscreen overlay). The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.
member.param: Text to output to the console.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.write(Unigine.Math.vec4,char)
member.summary: Writes the specified text to the console and displays it on the screen (onscreen overlay). The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.
member.param: Four-component vector specifying the text color in the RGBA format.
Text to output to the console.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.write(Console::LEVEL,char)
member.summary: Writes the specified text to the console and displays it on the screen (onscreen overlay). The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.
member.param: Text to output to the console.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getMessages(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int)
member.summary: Gets the messages written to the console and the onscreen overlay.
member.param: Maximum number of messages to retrieve.

member.summary: Gets the error messages written to the console and the onscreen overlay.

member.returns: Last warning message printed to the console.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.getLastError const

member.summary: Writes the text followed by the line terminator to the console and the onscreen overlay. The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.
member.param: Text to output to the console.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenWrite(char)
member.summary: Writes the text to the onscreen overlay only. The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.
member.param: Text to output to the console.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenWrite(Unigine.Math.vec4,char)
member.summary: Writes the text to the onscreen overlay only. The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.

member.summary: Writes the text to the onscreen overlay only. The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.
member.param: Text to output to the console.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenWriteLine(char)
member.summary: Writes the text only to the onscreen overlay followed by the line terminator. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.
member.param: Text to output to the console.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenWriteLine(Unigine.Math.vec4,char)
member.summary: Writes the text only to the onscreen overlay followed by the line terminator. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.
member.param: Four-component vector specifying the text color in the RGBA format.
Text to output to the console.

member.summary: Writes the text only to the onscreen overlay followed by the line terminator. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.
member.param: Text to output to the console.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.message(Unigine.Math.vec4,char,...)
member.summary: Writes the ordinary message to the console and the onscreen overlay. The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.
member.param: Four-component vector specifying the text color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.message(char,...)
member.summary: Writes the ordinary message to the console and the onscreen overlay. The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.warning(char,...)
member.summary: Writes the warning message to the console and the onscreen overlay. The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.error(char,...)
member.summary: Writes the error message to the console and the onscreen overlay. The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.messageLine(Unigine.Math.vec4,char,...)
member.summary: Writes the ordinary message to the console and the onscreen overlay followed by the line terminator. The onscreen overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenMessage(Unigine.Math.vec4,char,...)
member.summary: Writes the ordinary message to the onscreen overlay only. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.
member.param: Four-component vector specifying the text color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenMessage(char,...)
member.summary: Writes the ordinary message to the onscreen overlay only. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenWarning(char,...)
member.summary: Writes the warning message to the onscreen overlay only. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenError(char,...)
member.summary: Writes the error message to the onscreen overlay only. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenMessageLine(Unigine.Math.vec4,char,...)
member.summary: Writes the ordinary message only to the onscreen overlay followed by the line terminator. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.
member.param: Four-component vector specifying the text color in the RGBA format.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenMessageLine(char,...)
member.summary: Writes the ordinary message only to the onscreen overlay followed by the line terminator. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenWarningLine(char,...)
member.summary: Writes the warning message only to the onscreen overlay followed by the line terminator. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.

member.name: M:Unigine.Console.onscreenErrorLine(char,...)
member.summary: Writes the error message only to the onscreen overlay followed by the line terminator. The console overlay must be enabled for the text to be seen on the screen.

member.name: F:Unigine.Console.LEVEL_ERROR
member.summary: An error message.

member.name: F:Unigine.Console.LEVEL_NORMAL
member.summary: An ordinary message.

member.name: F:Unigine.Console.LEVEL_WARNING
member.summary: A warning.
